info.title: Waves Full Node (???)
info.description: The Waves node REST API is the main interface for interacting with the blockchain. See [documentation](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/node-api/) for more info. If this API lacks data you need, check the [Waves Data Services API](https://docs.waves.tech/en/building-apps/waves-api-and-sdk/waves-data-service-api).

get.description: Get a list of account addresses in the [node wallet](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/how-to-work-with-node-wallet)

post.description: Generate a new account address in the [node wallet](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/how-to-work-with-node-wallet)
Check a signature of a message signed by an account

get.description: Get a list addresses in the [node wallet](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/how-to-work-with-node-wallet) by a given range of indices. Max range {from}-{to} is 100 addresses
Export seed value for the {address}
Generate an address from a given public key
Get the regular balance at a given address
Get multiple accounts balances. For dozens of addresses, better use the POST method

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: For balance at height requests. Max number of blocks back from the current height is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default

post.description: Get multiple accounts balances. Max number of addresses is set by `waves.rest-api.transactions-by-address-limit`, 1000 by default

height.description: For balance at height requests. Max number of blocks back from the current height is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default

get.description: Get the effective balance at a given address
Read account data entries by given keys or a regular expression

parameters.name: matches
parameters.description: URL encoded (percent-encoded) regular expression to filter keys

post.description: Read account data entries by given keys
Sign a message with a private key associated with {address}

requestBody.description: Message to sign as a plain string

get.description: Check whether address {address} is valid or not
Account script meta
Get an account script or a dApp script with additional info by a given address

verifierComplexity.description: [Complexity](https://docs.waves.tech/en/ride/base-concepts/complexity) of an account script or the verifier function of the dApp script

callableComplexities.description: Complexity of callable functions of the dApp script. Empty for an account script

extraFee.description: Extra fee for transactions sending on behalf of the account

delete.description: Remove the account with address {address} from the wallet

post.description: Sign a message with a private key associated with {address}

requestBody.description: Message to sign as a plain string

post.description: Check a signature of a message signed by an account

get.summary: All types of balances in WAVES
get.description: Get the available, regular, generating, and effective balance, see [definitions](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/account/account-balance#account-balance-in-waves)
Get the minimum regular balance at a given address for {confirmations} blocks back from the current height. Max number of confirmations is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default
Get the minimum effective balance at a given address for {confirmations} blocks from the current height. Max number of confirmations is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default
Read account data entries by a given key
Get a block by its signature
Get a block by its ID
Get genesis block
Get a list of blocks forged by a given address. Max range {from}-{to} is 100 blocks
Get blocks at a given range of heights. Max range {from}-{to} is 100 blocks
Average delay in milliseconds between last `blockNum` blocks starting from block with `id`

parameters.name: blockNum
parameters.description: Number of blocks to count delay

get.description: Get the current blockchain height
Get a block at a given height
Get the block at the current blockchain height
Get the height of a block by its ID
Get block headers at a given height
Get headers of a given block
Get block headers at a given range of heights. Max range {from}-{to} is 100 blocks
Get headers of the block at the current blockchain height

post.description: Connect to peer
Clear blacklist

get.description: Get a list of all ever known not blacklisted peers with a publicly available declared address
Get a list of all peers currently connected to the node
Get a list of all currently blacklisted peers of the node
Suspended peers list
Get current miners reward status
Get miners reward status at height

Get transaction statuses by their ID. For dozens of transactions, better use the POST method.
Transactions in the response are in the same order as in the request.

post.description:
Get transaction statuses by their ID. Max number of transactions is set by `waves.rest-api.transactions-by-address-limit`, 1000 by default.
Transactions in the response are in the same order as in the request.

get.description: Get a transaction by its ID
Get a transactions by its IDs

post.summary: Sign transaction on behalf of wallet account
post.description: Sign a transaction with the private key corresponding to the `sender`. Sender must exist in the [node's wallet](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/how-to-work-with-node-wallet)

requestBody.description: Transaction [data in JSON](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction/#json-representation) including [`type`](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction-type/) and `sender`. If `timestamp` is omitted, current node's time is used. `senderPublicKey` is ignored.

get.description: Get a list of transactions in node's UTX pool

Get a list of the latest transactions involving a given address. Max number of transactions is set by `waves.rest-api.transactions-by-address-limit`, 1000 by default. For pagination, use the field {after}

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of transactions to be returned

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: ID of the transaction to paginate after

get.description: Get the number of transactions in the UTX pool
Get an unconfirmed transaction by its ID

post.description: Get the minimum fee for a given transaction

requestBody.description: Transaction [data in JSON](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction/#json-representation) including [`type`](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction-type/) and `senderPublicKey`. To calculate a sponsored fee, specify `feeAssetId`. `fee` and `sender` are ignored.

post.summary: Sign transaction on behalf of wallet account
post.description: Sign a transaction with the private key corresponding to a given address. The address must exist in the [node's wallet](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/how-to-work-with-node-wallet)

requestBody.description: Transaction [data in JSON](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction/#json-representation) including [`type`](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction-type/) and `sender`. If `timestamp` is omitted, current node's time is used. `senderPublicKey` is ignored.

post.description: Broadcast a signed transaction

get.description: Get [merkle proofs](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/block/merkle-root#proof-of-transaction-in-block) for given transactions. For dozens of transactions, better use the POST method

post.description: Get [merkle proofs](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/block/merkle-root#proof-of-transaction-in-block) for given transactions

get.description: Generate random seed of a given length in bytes. The returned value is base58 encoded

post.description: Compiles string code to base64 script representation

get.description: Current Node time (UTC)

post.description: Decompiles base64 script representation to string code
Compiles string code to base64 script representation
Compiles string code with imports to base64 script representation
Estimates complexity of a given compiled code

requestBody.description: Compiled code in base64 script representation

script.description: Compiled script in base64 script representation

verifierComplexity.description: [Complexity](https://docs.waves.tech/en/ride/base-concepts/complexity) of the account or asset script or the verifier function of the dApp script

callableComplexities.description: Complexity of callable functions of the dApp script. Empty for an account script or asset script

extraFee.description: Extra fee for transactions sending on behalf of the dApp or smart account or transactions involving the asset

post.description: Evaluates the provided expression, taking into account the deployed dApp contract

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of the deployed dApp contract

get.description: Generate random seed. The returned value is base58 encoded

post.description: Calculate the [Keccak-256](https://keccak.team/files/Keccak-submission-3.pdf) hash of the [BLAKE2b-256](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLAKE_%28hash_function%29) hash of a given message
Calculate the [BLAKE2b-256](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLAKE_%28hash_function%29) hash of a given message
Serialize transaction

get.description: Export wallet seed
Get an address associated with a given alias. Alias should be plain text without an 'alias' prefix and chain ID.
Get a list of aliases associated with a given address
Get account balances in all assets (excluding WAVES and NFTs) at a given address

reissuable.description: Indicates if the asset is reissuable

minSponsoredAssetFee.description: For [sponsored asset](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/waves-protocol/sponsored-fee) only: the equivalent of 0.001 WAVES

sponsorBalance.description: For [sponsored asset](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/waves-protocol/sponsored-fee) only: the sponsor balance in WAVES

get.description: Get detailed information about a given asset. See [fields descriptions](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/token/#custom-token-parameters)
Get detailed information about given assets. See [fields descriptions](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/token/#custom-token-parameters)
Get the account balance in a given asset
Get asset balance distribution by addresses
Get asset balance distribution by addresses at a given height. Max number of addresses is set by `waves.rest-api.distribution-address-limit`, 1000 by default. For pagination, use the field {after}

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: For balance at height requests. Max number of blocks back from the current height is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of addresses to be returned

get.description:
Get a list of [non-fungible tokens](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/token/non-fungible-token) at a given address. Max for 1000 tokens. For pagination, use the field {after}. See [fields descriptions](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/token/#custom-token-parameters).
Since activation of [feature #15](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/features/) this method returns only tokens that are issued as NFT (amount: 1, decimal places: 0, reissuable: false) after activation of feature #13. Before activation of feature #15 the method returned all the assets that are issued as NFT.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of tokens to be returned

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: ID of the token to paginate after

get.description: Get all active leases involving a given address
Account generating balance
Base target of a block with a given ID
Base target of a last block
Shows which consensus algo being using
Activation statuses of [blockchain features](https://docs.waves.tech/en/waves-node/features/)

height.description: Current blockchain height on the node

votingThreshold.description: Number of blocks that support a feature to approve it

nextCheck.description: Next height to calculate feature statuses

nodeStatus.description: Support for the feature on the node

supportingBlocks.description: Number of blocks that support for the feature

post.description: Prints a string at DEBUG level, strips to 100 chars

get.description: Regular address balance at the current height
All info you need to debug
Get sizes and full hashes for last blocks

parameters.name: howMany
parameters.description: How many last blocks to take

get.description: Get state hash at height. Available only if node configuration contains `waves.db.store-state-hashes = true` option

post.description: Move a given peer to the blacklist for the time specified in `waves.network.black-list-residence-time`, 15 min by default. The connection to the peer is immediately closed (if it was open)

404.description: There are no peer with such address

get.description: Get current portfolio considering pessimistic transactions in the UTX pool

parameters.name: considerUnspent
parameters.description: Taking into account pessimistic transactions from UTX pool

delete.description: Rollback the state to the block with a given ID

post.description: Validates a transaction and measures time spent in milliseconds. You should use the JSON transaction format with proofs

get.description: Get history of the regular balance at a given address. Max depth is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default

get.summary: Regular address balance at the height
get.description: Regular address balance at the height. Max number of blocks back from the current height is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default

post.description: Removes all blocks after a given height. Max number of blocks back from the current height is set by `waves.db.max-rollback-depth`, 2000 by default

get.description: All miner info you need to debug
Currently running node config
Get state changes made by the transaction

get.summary: List of transactions by address with state changes
get.description: Get a list of transactions involving a given address with state changes. Max for 1000 transactions. To get the next 1000 transactions, use the field {after}

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of transactions to be returned

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: ID of the transaction to paginate after

post.description: Stop the node

get.description: Get status of the running core
Get Waves node version

verifierComplexity.description: [Complexity](https://docs.waves.tech/en/ride/base-concepts/complexity) of an account or asset script or the verifier function of the dApp script

callableComplexities.description: Complexity of callable functions of the dApp script. Empty for an account script or asset script

extraFee.description: Extra fee for transactions sending on behalf of the dApp or smart account or transactions involving the asset

status.description: not_found: transaction is not found, unconfirmed: transaction is in the UTX pool, confirmed: transaction is added to the block or microblock

height.description: The sequential number of the block that contains the transaction

confirmations.description: Number of blocks added on top of the one that contains the transaction

applicationStatus.description: succeeded: transaction is successful, script_execution_failed: the dApp script or the asset script failed. See [Transaction Validation](https://docs.waves.tech/en/blockchain/transaction/transaction-validation) for details

transactionIndex.description: Sequential number of the transaction in the block

merkleProof.description: Array of sibling hashes of the Merkle tree, bottom-to-top

value.description: binary/boolean/integer/string value or list of { type, value } objects

ApiKeyNotValid.description: Provided API key is not correct

example.message: Provided API key is not correct

BadRequest.description: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax
